Previewing and Publishing a Mobile App Experience

In this topic you will learn how to preview and publish a mobile app experience.

Previewing a mobile app experience lets you see how the experience is going to display on a mobile device. To preview a mobile app experience, edit the experience and then click Preview in the Experience Editor.

There are two options:

  • Responsive Preview - Opens the experience in a new browser window for preview
  • Get Shareable Link - Provides a preview URL so the preview can be shared with others.

The Shareable URL that is generated is valid for 72 hours.

Note: If you have configured any session timeout as part of any access control settings, the 72 hour timeout will override your configured session timeout. When the experience is published, the session timeout (if any) will be enforced.

Publishing a mobile app experience

Publishing a mobile app experience generates an access key. The access key is required by the device applications (iOS and Android) to access the experience. To publish a mobile app experience, follow these steps:

Note: If you recently made changes to video metadata or playlists, those changes may take up to 6 minutes to appear on published experiences.
  1. Click on the experience name to open it in the Experience Editor.
  2. Click Publish.
  3. On the publish confirmation dialog, click Publish Now.
  4. The experience will be published and the site URL will be displayed.

    Once the experience is published, the access key will be displayed as part of the experience details on the Experiences home page.

Installing the iOS native application

Installing the Android native application

Publishing changes to an experience

When you make changes to an experience, it must be republished. Experiences that need to be republished will display an Experience Status of Unpublished Changes.

To republish the changes, follow the steps outlined in the Publishing a mobile app experience section of this topic.

Taking a mobile app experience offline

If a mobile app experience is taken offline, it will no longer be accessible from native mobile applications. To take an experience offline, click on a row and then click Take Offline. To confirm that the experience should be taken offline, click Take Offline. To make the experience available again, the experience must be republished.

Note: Taking the experience offline does not delete the experience.
